memberdef.name: Yap_ArgListToVector
memberdef.initializer: Yap_ArgListToVector__(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, l, def, n, a, e)

briefdescription.para: a flag is represented as a Prolog term

detaileddescription.para: This is done in two phases: early on, it takes care of the atomic flags that are required by other modules; later, it looks at flags that are structured terms

parameterdescription.para: wether this is done before stack initialization, or afterwards Complex terms can only be built in the second step

briefdescription.para: This function implements the sigsegv prolog flag.

detaileddescription.para: It should be called when we want other languages to take over handling this signal

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of an argument key, or -1 if not found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *file, const char *function, int lineno, Term listl, const param_t *def, int n, xarg *a, yap_error_number e)
memberdef.name: Yap_ArgListToVector__

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *file, const char *function, int lineno, Term listl, const param2_t *def, int n, yap_error_number e)
memberdef.name: Yap_ArgList2ToVector__

briefdescription.para: Yap_ArgList2ToVector is much the same as before, but assumes parameters also have something called a scope.
